1:
Have mercy on me, God, because of your covenant faithfulness;\q for the sake of the multitude of your merciful actions, blot out my transgressions.
\q
2:
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity\q and cleanse me from my sin.


\q
3:
For I know my transgressions,\q and my sin is always before me.
\q
5:
See, I was born in iniquity;\q as soon as my mother conceived me, I was in sin.
\q
6:
See, you desire trustworthiness in my heart;\q in my heart you will make me know wisdom.


\q
7:
Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean;\q wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
\q
8:
Make me hear joy and gladness\q so that the bones that you have broken may rejoice.
\q
9:
Hide your face from my sins\q and blot out all my iniquities.


\q
10:
Create in me a clean heart, God,\q and renew a right spirit within me.
\q
11:
Do not drive me away from your presence,\q and do not take your holy Spirit from me.


\q
12:
Restore to me the joy of your salvation,\q and sustain me with a willing spirit.
\q
13:
Then will I teach transgressors your ways,\q and sinners will be converted to you.


\q
14:
Forgive me for shedding blood, God of my salvation,\q and I will shout for the joy of your righteousness.
\q
15:
Lord, open my lips,\q and my mouth will express your praise.
\q
16:
For you do not delight in sacrifice, or I would give it;\q you have no pleasure in burnt offerings.


\q
17:
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit.\q You, God, will not despise a broken and a contrite heart.
\q
18:
Do good in your good pleasure to Zion;\q rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
\q
19:
Then will you delight in the sacrifices of righteousness,\q in burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings;
\q then our people will offer bulls on your altar.
